intro: Alsine macrocarpa var. sibirica, commonly known as Siberian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically has hairy stems and leaves that are often succulent, adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is native to regions of Siberia and Central Asia. This species is often found in open, disturbed habitats and is noted for its resilience in harsh climatic conditions.
